This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"computeCredentialDigest(string,address,string,string,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This uses the internal _hashCredential function."},"dualHash(bytes)":{"details":"Combines keccak256 and SHA-256 for dual hashing.","params":{"data":"The data to be hashed."},"returns":{"keccakHash":"The keccak256 hash of the data.","sha256Hash":"The SHA-256 hash of the data."}},"eip712Domain()":{"details":"returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature."},"getIssuedTimestamp(string)":{"details":"Returns the issuance timestamp of a credential.","params":{"id":"The credential ID."},"returns":{"_0":"The timestamp when the credential was issued. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; helper function remains unchanged. ==="}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"issueVerifiableCredential(string,string,string,uint256,string[],string[],string,string)":{"details":"Issues a new verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"context":"The context array for the credential.","credentialType":"The type array for the credential.","data":"The credential data.","expiresAt":"The expiration timestamp of the credential.","id":"The unique ID of the credential.","proofCreator":"The creator of the proof. === NEW CODE: Clarification === This function now verifies the subject DID via the DIDManager's isVerified function.","proofType":"The type of proof.","subject":"The DID of the subject."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeCredential(string)":{"details":"Revokes a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to revoke. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; revocation logic remains intact. ==="}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"signCredential(string,bytes)":{"details":"Adds a digital signature to a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to sign.","signature":"The digital signature to attach to the credential. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; signing logic remains intact. ==="}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"validateDIDCredential(string,string)":{"details":"Validates a DID credential by verifying its signature and associated role.","params":{"credentialId":"The ID of the credential to validate.","requiredRole":"The required role for validation."},"returns":{"isValid":"True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: Note that this function uses AccessControl's hasRole on the issuer. You might consider integrating DIDManager.validateDIDRole if you prefer centralized DID role checks. For now, it checks that the issuer (msg.sender when issuing) has the required role. ==="}},"validateVerifiableCredential(string)":{"details":"Validates a verifiable credential by checking its existence, expiry, and signature.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to validate."},"returns":{"_0":"isValid True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: No changes needed here; function aligns with the overall design. ==="}},"verifyIPFSHash(bytes,bytes32)":{"details":"Verifies an IPFS hash using dual-hashing mechanisms.","params":{"dualHashCombination":"The combined hash (keccak256 dualHash(bytes).details: Combines keccak256 and SHA-256 for dual hashing.

returns.keccakHash: The keccak256 hash of the data.
returns.sha256Hash: The SHA-256 hash of the data.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

getIssuedTimestamp(string).details: Returns the issuance timestamp of a credential.

returns._0: The timestamp when the credential was issued. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; helper function remains unchanged. ===

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

issueVerifiableCredential(string,string,.details: Issues a new verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.context: The context array for the credential.
params.credentialType: The type array for the credential.
params.expiresAt: The expiration timestamp of the credential.
params.id: The unique ID of the credential.
params.proofCreator: The creator of the proof. === NEW CODE: Clarification === This function now verifies the subject DID via the DIDManager's isVerified function.
params.subject: The DID of the subject.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeCredential(string).details: Revokes a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.id: The ID of the credential to revoke. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; revocation logic remains intact. ===

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

signCredential(string,bytes).details: Adds a digital signature to a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.id: The ID of the credential to sign.
params.signature: The digital signature to attach to the credential. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; signing logic remains intact. ===

validateDIDCredential(string,string).details: Validates a DID credential by verifying its signature and associated role.

params.credentialId: The ID of the credential to validate.

returns.isValid: True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: Note that this function uses AccessControl's hasRole on the issuer. You might consider integrating DIDManager.validateDIDRole if you prefer centralized DID role checks. For now, it checks that the issuer (msg.sender when issuing) has the required role. ===

validateVerifiableCredential(string).details: Validates a verifiable credential by checking its existence, expiry, and signature.

params.id: The ID of the credential to validate.

returns._0: isValid True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: No changes needed here; function aligns with the overall design. ===

verifyIPFSHash(bytes,bytes32).details: Verifies an IPFS hash using dual-hashing mechanisms.

computeCredentialDigest(string,address,s.notice: Returns the EIP-712 digest for a given credential.
